title: Front Brake Disc - Removal

body.body: Before starting work, ensure the motorcycle is stabilised and adequately supported. This will help prevent it from falling and causing injury to the operator or damage to the motorcycle.
Remove front wheel DC3; DC4; DD2; DP3; DP4
To avoid wheel damage, always support the wheel as instructed below. A dangerous riding condition leading to loss of motorcycle control and an accident could result if this warning is ignored.
The fixings securing the brake disc to the wheel also secures the ABS pulser ring.
Note the orientation of the brake discs and the ABS pulser ring fitted for installation.
Support the wheel on blocks to avoid damage to the wheel centre and brake disc.
Remove and discard the brake disc fixings and remove the brake disc and the ABS pulser ring, if fitted.
Repeat the steps for the other side.
